review: I wanted to have an easy way to watch Amazon videos, replacing a burnt-out Roku HD which I had before. I was also hoping to use the WiDi display mirroring (Miracast) to share my Windows 8 screen easily without cables.After about 2 months (a bit too late to return), I realized a new Roku might have been a better choice. Here's why:Pros:- easy to access movies and shows - no need to start a special app to get to your Amazon content- voice search for movies is very good, it really works - no need to hunt-and-peck the letters on the screen- when playing music from your Amazon music library, it shows the lyrics in sync with the song (for many but not all songs)Cons:- the user interface is simply bad; I get a headache trying to use it. The UI on the Amazon Prime Video app on Roku is actually a lot better- apps have problems - for example, I tried to watch a video on Vevo: it ran the ad but then the video did not start; tried it several times, same result (never had a problem with apps on my old Roku)- the display mirroring (Miracast) simply does not work - tried both a Surface Pro 3 and a Lenovo running Windows 8.1 (those worked with a Roku stick)- the voice search doesn't work for other content - e.g., music or apps; so it's back to hunt-and-peck for those (how hard would it be to support a bluetooth keyboard or allow using iPad/Kindle/Android phone as a keyboard; or, for that matter, my old Blackberry with a real keyboard :)- entering the video PIN on screen in front of others (guests or kids) makes the PIN pretty much useless - even though the digits are displayed as dots, anyone paying attention will see which numbers are being selected; there's gotta be a better way

review: I've been using the Fire TV Stick for a couple of months now and it has been great.  When the Sling TV deal came up I decided to get a Fire TV for another TV.  I setup the Fire TV in the evening and watched a few shows on it.  When I came out in the morning the device was dead, no power light and the TV didn't see any device hooked up to that HDMI port.  Amazon support had me try a couple things then shipped out a new unit.The new unit arrived and I set it up and it was working great.  24 hours later I went to reboot it since Netflix wasn't working and it never turned back on.  Again called support, went through a few troubleshooting steps and the are sending a new unit.The Fire TV is great when it works but they seem to have some quality issues right now and are shipping out defective devices.
author: Ravie McDonald
